Grabs the account from any Mastodon link and lets you pick which Lists to add them to.

SHORTCUT "Add account to Mastodon list"
SET $Input = @input
ACTION comment WFCommentActionText="Grabs the account from any Mastodon link and lets you pick which Lists to add them to."
ACTION comment WFCommentActionText="Use this shortcut add someone on Mastodon to one of your lists.\n\nThis shortcut takes an account or status link, find the user’s ID, looks up which Lists they might already belong to, pulls your Lists and presents them to pick from, and then adds the correspoding ID to that List – all using the Mastodon API.\n\nThe User ID lookup uses the public API for Mastodon, but everything involving your account and lists requires access tokens – I use separate tokens for Read and Write access for Lists specifically, which you can set up in the Development settings on Mastodon: https://mastodon.social/settings/applications"
ACTION url WFURLActionURL="https://mastodon.social"
ACTION geturlcomponent WFURL=`{@prev}` WFURLComponent="Host"
SET $Instance = @prev
ACTION comment WFCommentActionText="Look up user ID from handle in URL: https://docs.joinmastodon.org/methods/accounts/#lookup"
ACTION geturlcomponent WFURL=`{$Input}` WFURLComponent="Path"
ACTION text.split WFTextCustomSeparator="/" WFTextSeparator="Custom" text=@prev
ACTION getitemfromlist WFItemIndex="2" WFItemSpecifier="Item At Index" WFItemRangeStart="2"
SET $Handle = @prev
ACTION url WFURLActionURL=`https://{$Instance}/api/v1/accounts/lookup?acct={$Handle}`
ACTION downloadurl WFURL=`{@prev}` ShowHeaders=true
ACTION detect.dictionary
ACTION getvalueforkey WFDictionaryKey="id"
SET $User_ID = @prev
ACTION comment WFCommentActionText="Look up existing Lists for this ID: https://docs.joinmastodon.org/methods/accounts/#lookup\n"
ACTION runworkflow WFWorkflowName="Mastodon API List Read Access Token" WFWorkflow={"workflowIdentifier": "DA60239D-4D65-4F59-BD7D-E1F6A5E72D4D", "workflowName": "Mastodon API List Read Access Token", "isSelf": false}
SET $Read_Access_Token = @prev
ACTION url WFURLActionURL=`https://{$Instance}/api/v1/accounts/{$User_ID}/lists?access_token={$Read_Access_Token}`
ACTION downloadurl WFURL=`{@prev}`
ACTION detect.dictionary
FOREACH @prev
ACTION getvalueforkey WFDictionaryKey="title"
ENDFOREACH
ACTION text.combine text=@repeat_each
SET $Existing_Lists = @prev
ACTION comment WFCommentActionText="Choose from Lists and grab ID."
ACTION url WFURLActionURL=`https://{$Instance}/api/v1/lists?access_token={$Read_Access_Token}`
ACTION downloadurl WFHTTPHeaders={"Value": {"WFDictionaryFieldValueItems": []}, "WFSerializationType": "WFDictionaryFieldValue"} ShowHeaders=true WFURL=`{@prev}`
ACTION detect.dictionary
FOREACH @prev
ACTION getvalueforkey WFDictionaryKey="title"
IF @prev has_any_value
ACTION getvalueforkey WFDictionaryKey="id"
ACTION setvalueforkey WFDictionaryValue=`{@prev}` WFDictionary=$Dictionary WFDictionaryKey=`{@getvalueforkey}`
ELSE
ACTION nothing
ENDIF
SET $Dictionary = @conditional
ENDFOREACH
ACTION getvalueforkey WFGetDictionaryValueType="All Keys"
ACTION filter.files WFContentItemInputParameter=@prev WFContentItemSortProperty="Name" WFContentItemSortOrder="A to Z"
IF $Existing_Lists has_any_value
ACTION gettext WFTextActionText=` They're already added to these:

{$Existing_Lists}`
ELSE
ACTION nothing
ENDIF
ACTION gettext WFTextActionText=`Which list(s) do you want to add {$Handle} to?{@conditional}`
ACTION choosefromlist WFChooseFromListActionPrompt=`{@prev}` WFChooseFromListActionSelectMultiple=true
FOREACH @prev
ACTION getvalueforkey WFDictionaryKey=`{$Repeat_Item}`
ENDFOREACH
SET $List_ID_s_ = @getvalueforkey
ACTION comment WFCommentActionText="Add account ID to chosen List: https://docs.joinmastodon.org/methods/lists/#accounts-add"
ACTION runworkflow WFWorkflow={"workflowIdentifier": "B9C53120-51F5-42AB-8EB0-3B84EA6C724F", "workflowName": "Mastodon API List Write Access Token", "isSelf": false} WFWorkflowName="Mastodon API List Write Access Token"
SET $Write_Access_Token = @prev
ACTION list WFItems=["￼", "PLACEHOLDER"]
ACTION dictionary WFItems={"Value": {"WFDictionaryFieldValueItems": {"account_ids": {"Value": [], "WFSerializationType": "WFArrayParameterState"}}}, "WFSerializationType": "WFDictionaryFieldValue"}
ACTION setvalueforkey WFDictionaryValue=`{@list}` WFDictionary=@prev WFDictionaryKey="account_ids"
ACTION comment WFCommentActionText="Shortcuts has trouble storing single values as an array when flattening dictionaries into plain text — if only one item is passed into an array, it’s *technically not* an array anymore and is actually a single string.\n\nTo get around this, I’ve invented this PLACEHOLDER method that’s used to “fake” a second item, and which is then removed from the JSON using Replace Text – then you’re lefting with a properly-formatted array field with only a single item."
ACTION text.replace WFReplaceTextFind=",\"PLACEHOLDER\""
ACTION detect.dictionary
ACTION url WFURLActionURL=`https://{$Instance}/api/v1/lists/{$List_ID_s_}/accounts?access_token={$Write_Access_Token}`
ACTION downloadurl WFHTTPBodyType="File" WFRequestVariable=@detect_dictionary WFURL=`{@prev}` WFJSONValues={"Value": {"WFDictionaryFieldValueItems": []}, "WFSerializationType": "WFDictionaryFieldValue"} WFHTTPMethod="POST"
ACTION detect.dictionary
ACTION showresult Text=`{@prev}`
IF @prev equals_string "{}"
ACTION gettext WFTextActionText=`Success! Added {$Handle} to:

{@Chosen_List_s_}`
ACTION showresult Text=`{@prev}`
ENDIF

ACTION selectcontacts
FOREACH @choosefromlist

Automatically plays one of your Station presets depending on the time of day.

SHORTCUT "Auto-station"
ACTION comment WFCommentActionText="Automatically plays one of your Station presets depending on the time of day."
ACTION comment WFCommentActionText="This shortcut takes the current time, converts it to 24-hour time, then grabs just the Number value and uses it in an "If" conditional – if before 8pm (or 20), play podcast "A", otherwise if after 8pm play podcast "B."

Includes Import Questions for pre-selecting the podcasts.I built this shortcut as a novel example of how one shortcut could be used to behave differently depending on the time of day – plus, I like to listen to certain podcasts at certain times of day (and avoid shows that are too interesting during the workday so I don’t get distracted).

To accomplish something similar, try using the “If” action to create conditionals in your shortcuts, letting something different happen each time you run the shortcut depending on how the condition is met.

This uses the current Time values inside "If" conditionals so that something different happens depending whether the shortcut is run before or after a certain time of day.

To be more specific, formatting the Time into a single 24-hour value lets the “If” action’s conditions utilize “less than” or “equal to”-type math to check against the current hour – in iOS 13, the “If” action’s conditions change depending on the type of content used.

Feel free to give your own a more creative name – I was trying to be descriptive :)

Built for @kcjokes on Twitter: https://twitter.com/kcjokes/status/1213179125881540608?s=21"
ACTION format.date WFDateFormatStyle="Custom" WFDateFormat="H" WFDate=`{@date}`
ACTION detect.number
IF @prev equals_number "20"
ACTION sirikit.donation.handle IntentData="<binary:3282bytes>" ForceExecutionOnPhone=false ShowWhenRun=true
ELSE
ACTION sirikit.donation.handle ShowWhenRun=true ForceExecutionOnPhone=false IntentData="<binary:3279bytes>"
ENDIF

SET $Icon = @prev
ACTION com.apple.shortcuts.AddShortcutToHomeScreenAction title=`{$Title}` shortcut=$Repeat_Item image=@prev
ENDFOREACH

Asks you to choose the type of caffeinated drink (coffee, espresso, cappuccino, or a soda) and logs the caffeine content into the Health app. Also compares against the daily recommended limit of milligrams of caffeine.

SHORTCUT "Log caffeine"
ACTION comment WFCommentActionText="Asks you to choose the type of caffeinated drink (coffee, espresso, cappuccino, or a soda) and logs the caffeine content into the Health app. Also compares against the daily recommended limit of milligrams of caffeine."
ACTION comment WFCommentActionText="Caffeine values based on average estimates – better to overestimate and avoid an overload than underestimate to maybe not get enough.\n\nAlso accounts for 2/3 of the drink being water and logs those ounces into Health as well – although it's still dehydrating.\n\nDoes not work on iPad."
MENU "What did you drink?"
CASE "Espresso"
ACTION number WFNumberActionNumber="1.5"
SET $Oz = @prev
ACTION number WFNumberActionNumber="31.8"
CASE "Coffee"
ACTION dictionary WFItems={"Value": {"WFDictionaryFieldValueItems": {"Small": "8", "Normal": "12", "Large": "16", "Travel mug": "20"}}, "WFSerializationType": "WFDictionaryFieldValue"}
ACTION choosefromlist WFChooseFromListActionPrompt="Which size?"
SET $Oz = @prev
ACTION com.alexhay.ToolboxProForShortcuts.SwitchCaseIntent matchReturn2="135" matchReturn1="90" matchReturn4="225" match4="Travel mug" matchReturn3="180" input=`{@prev}` match3="Large" match2="Normal" match1="Small"
CASE "Soda"
ACTION number WFNumberActionNumber=12
SET $Oz = @prev
ACTION number WFNumberActionNumber=41
CASE "(Check goal)"
ACTION gettext WFTextActionText="-1"
ENDMENU
SET $Number = @choosefrommenu
IF $Number is_greater_than 0
MENU "When did you drink it?"
CASE "Now"
ACTION date
CASE "Earlier"
ACTION ask WFAskActionDefaultAnswerDateAndTime=`{@date}` WFInputType="Time" WFAskActionPrompt="What time?"
ENDMENU
SET $Date = @choosefrommenu
ACTION health.quantity.log WFQuantitySampleDate=`{$Date}` WFQuantitySampleAdditionalQuantity=QTY(0, "mg") WFQuantitySampleQuantity=QTY($Number, "mg") WFQuantitySampleType="Caffeine"
ACTION nothing
IF $Oz is_greater_than 0
ACTION math WFMathOperation="×" WFMathOperand=4
ACTION math WFMathOperation="÷" WFMathOperand=5
ACTION health.quantity.log WFQuantitySampleDate=`{$Date}` WFQuantitySampleAdditionalQuantity=QTY(0, "fl_oz_us") WFQuantitySampleQuantity=QTY(@prev, "fl_oz_us") WFQuantitySampleType="Water"
ELSE
ENDIF
ELSE
IF $Number is_less_than "0"
ACTION alert WFAlertActionCancelButtonShown=false WFAlertActionMessage="No caffeine logged!"
ACTION exit
ELSE
ENDIF
ENDIF
ACTION filter.health.quantity WFHKSampleFilteringGroupBy="Day" WFContentItemLimitEnabled=false WFHKSampleFilteringFillMissing=false WFHKSampleFilteringUnit="mg" WFContentItemFilter={"Value": {"WFActionParameterFilterPrefix": 1, "WFActionParameterFilterTemplates": [{"Bounded": true, "Operator": 4, "Values": {"Enumeration": {"Value": "Caffeine", "WFSerializationType": "WFStringSubstitutableState"}}, "Removable": false, "Property": "Type"}, {"Bounded": true, "Operator": 1002, "Values": {"Unit": 16, "Number": 7}, "Removable": false, "Property": "Start Date"}], "WFContentPredicateBoundedDate": false}, "WFSerializationType": "WFContentPredicateTableTemplate"}
ACTION round
ACTION math WFMathOperation="÷" WFMathOperand=400
ACTION math WFMathOperation="×" WFMathOperand=100
ACTION round
ACTION measurement.create WFMeasurementUnit=QTY(@round, "mg") WFMeasurementUnitType="Mass"
ACTION showresult Text=`You're at {@prev} of caffeine.

That's {@round}% of the total recommended daily limit.`
